description: Purchase of a Radio Frequency Vector Signal Generator
full_summary:
**Radio Frequency Vector Signal Generator Request for Proposal**
================================================================

**Reference Number**
-----------------

WS3570638288-Doc3684898091

**Publication Date**
-------------------

September 29, 2022

**Closing Date**
---------------

October 25, 2022, 2:00 p.m. EST

**Amendment Number**
-----------------

2

**Request for Proposal**
---------------------

Health Canada is seeking a Radio Frequency (RF) vector signal generator and two compatible power sensors to provide new testing capacity.

**Mandatory Requirements**
-------------------------

* The RF vector signal generator must be capable of generating a radio frequency signal in the range of 100 MHz to 20 GHz.
* The two compatible power sensors must be able to measure power levels in the range of -30 dBm to 30 dBm.
* The system must be compatible with existing test equipment and infrastructure.

**Key Dates**
-------------

* The expected contract start date is November 2, 2022.
* The expected contract end date is March 31, 2024.
* The system must be delivered to Ottawa, ON by March 29, 2023.

**Evaluation Criteria**
-----------------------

Bids will be evaluated based on a combination of technical merit and price.

**Trade Agreements**
------------------

This solicitation is open to bidders who are able to comply with the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement.

**Contact Information**
---------------------

For more information, please contact Yessica Karnali (Monteith) at  yessicakarnali.wijayaputri@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Notice URL**
----------------

http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14240801?extsite=MTQyNDA4MDFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

I rewrote your poorly written government tender announcement into a better version. I excluded every unecessary word. I based my response on a fairly generic text since you would not publish a version for the public which could reasonably have different specifics unkown to you. 

Let me know if I need to improve any things for you. 

Thanks for hiring me! I produced this snippet.

Best regards.
